intro: Polygala nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sandy soils and rocky areas. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to native pollinators. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
